column4: any idea why windows often open up behind other windows?  Shouldn't they show up on top?
bicchi unless the ATI installer has an uninstall mode, I don't think there is a good answer.  That's why packages are nice :)
bicchi if you could get a list of all the files it installed you could remove by hand
yeah unfortunally i am finding this the hard way
bicchi can you just leave the files there?  clutter, I know...but do you really need them removed?
no i don't, the problem is that i am trying to use my dual monitor setup and its not working. I even tried the fglrx drivers and no luck either
bicchi: no ideas.  the nvidia installer has an --uninstall option.  Don't know if ATI does also
it only works when i use the ati drivers that come with ubuntu
bicchi: I have nvidia not ATI...
bicchi: so I don't really know
do you also have dual monitors
I don't know, nvidia's twinview didn't impress me.  I ended up using the other mode
the problem is that when i move windows inside kde i get a lot of drag from the edges of the windows been displayed.
the same happens in gnome. so i think it has to do with the acceleration.
